title: Filipino Americans
summary: Filipino Americans (Filipino: Mga Pilipinong Amerikano) are Americans of Filipino ancestry. Filipinos in North America were first documented in the 16th century[7] and other small settlements beginning in the 18th century.[8] Mass migration did not begin until after the end of the Spanishâ€“American War at the end of the 19th century, when the Philippines was ceded from Spain to the United States in the Treaty of Paris.[9][10]
